Summary Driven by the market potential of new ideas, start-up businesses, and increasing the global quality of life; Greg seeks to facilitate quantum change in the way we think and act within our business. He has applied his knowledge and entrepreneurial skill set to early stage ventures and performed duties that include defining value propositions, evaluating market potential, financial modeling, risk management, and designing-then-refining operations. He is committed to collaborating with movers and shakers and is focused on helping aspiring entrepreneurs.

"To do real and permanent good in this world"- Carnegie Experience Market Research Contractor Stax Inc. & Verbatim Advisory Group September 2014  –  June 2015  (10 months) Greater Boston Area Greg works with teams of Stax consultants gathering primary and secondary research in a medley of industries. 
 
Stax Inc. is a global strategy consulting firm with offices in Boston, Chicago, New York, and Colombo, Sri Lanka. Stax provides clients with actionable answers based on deep research and analysis. Founded in 1994, Stax works with clients ranging from the Fortune 500 and ten of the top global LBO firms, to middle market private equity firms and their portfolio companies. Stax applies a nimble, collaborative approach to drive well-informed decisions and tangible results. Projects include business and market strategy, customer analyses, marketing analytics and commercial due diligence, with targeted engagements around revenue generation, ROI maximization, and M&A. For more information, visit www.stax.com. 
 
Greg also worked with Verbatim Advisory Group's primary research team to uncover monthly changes in public companies. 
 
Vebatim Advisory Group’s rigorous and disciplined approach to Channel Investigations provides Buy Side analysts with a natural extension of their own research efforts. Clients use Verbatim to investigate a new set of companies, validate assumptions about companies where there may be information gaps, or monitor core holdings 
 
Verbatim’s custom and proprietary reports contain field-level intelligence untainted by CEO comments, financial models, or macro market analysis. We answer your specific questions, leveraging our standardized processes, proprietary database and quality controls to deliver the unique insights you need. The problem presented to my team and I was a statistical perspective of poor feedback or a withdrawal from the program. After investigating the programs we found that the kids were active, engaged in events or crafts, and having an over all great time. With further due diligence we discovered a communication gap between the kids and their parents. 
 
My team and I embarked on creating a social dynamic with YMCA staff, parents, and the children. This Included utilization of social media/network tools. Reworking the delivery system of newsletters, schedules, and special events. Finally implementing a business practice of natural face-to-face interaction with staff, parents, and child with the purpose of building a stronger relationship towards the program. Summary As Senior Vice President, Joe Goodwin is responsible for the global development, implementation and oversight of all external and internal facing marketing and leasing initiatives for the entire Asset Campus Housing portfolio which is comprised of over 130 properties / 70,000 beds. With over 10 years experience in the student housing arena, Joe has in depth operational knowledge in over 70 student housing markets.  
 
Working along side the Director of Marketing, Joe helps lead the team of the Regional Marketing Directors (RMD's) and New Lease Up Specialists to create and implement very specialized identity creation, creative marketing and residence life programs geared towards students.  
 
Working closely with all RMD's, Regionals, and New Lease Up Specialists Joe ensures that governance and the company brand is upheld across multiple properties and initiatives. This includes property websites, print, online marketing, and social media marketing of all the properties within the Asset Campus portfolio.  
 
Joe leads all market research efforts, and oversees and develops training efforts in customer service, leasing, and resident retention. With past operational experience working in troubled markets, Joe is invaluable in his ability to quickly identify market issues and develop and implement plans to help stabilize leasing and marketing efforts. 
 
Joe is also part of the acquisitions and development team for ACH. He assists in performing due diligence's for acquisitions for student housing properties and has executed analysis and feasibility studies, studies of student markets, and has also help oversee 80+ new construction start up lease ups throughout the country.
